revised_title: Fossil Flora of the Black Limestones in Teila Quarry: Diplopteridium teilianum and Other Fern-like Fronds
tldr: The authors studied the fossil flora of the black limestones in Teila Quarry, Gwaenysgor, near Prestatyn, Flintshire, focusing on the fern-like frond Diplopteridium teilianum. They collected a large number of fossil plants and animals from the plant-bearing beds and compared the assemblage to other Lower Carboniferous floras. The authors also described the morphology and structure of D. teilianum, including its pinnate fronds and unique branching patterns.
